channel.title: NYT > Home Page
channel.description: New York Times > Breaking News, World News & Multimedia
channel.copyright: Copyright 2007 The New York Times Company

item.title: Framework for Mideast Peace Talks Set at Conference
item.description: President Bush today announced a joint decision between Israeli and Palestinian leaders to work toward a peace agreement by the end of 2008.
item.author: STEVEN LEE MYERS and HELENE COOPER

item.title: Bits : Verizon Opens Up Wireless Network
item.description: Verizon Wireless said that it plans to offer two flavors of service: a traditional bundle and a “bring your own” device service.
item.author: SAUL HANSELL

item.title: 86 Police Officers Hurt in Paris Riots
item.description: Officials said that a Paris suburb saw more intense violence last night than during the riots of 2005.
item.author: KATRIN BENNHOLD

item.title: Sean Taylor, Redskins Star, Dies After Shooting
item.description: The Washington Redskins’ safety, who was shot yesterday by an intruder at his home, died today from his injury.
item.author: KIRK SEMPLE

item.title: Home Prices Down 4.5% Nationwide From Last Year
item.description: New reports painted a grim housing picture, with prices falling even more steeply in 20 major metropolitan areas.
item.author: MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

item.title: Stocks Rebound on Citi and Oil News
item.description: Financial shares rose after the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority made a $7.5 billion investment in Citigroup and as crude oil futures fell nearly $3 a barrel.
item.author: MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

item.title: Astor’s Son in Court to Face Charges
item.description: Brooke Astor’s son, Anthony D. Marshall, and a lawyer, Francis X. Morrissey Jr., were told to surrender to authorities today to face criminal charges.
item.author: COLIN MOYNIHAN and SERGE F. KOVALESKI

item.title: Musharraf Prepares to Drop Army Role
item.description: Gen. Pervez Musharraf made farewell calls to Pakistan’s armed forces, a day before he drops his role as army chief.
item.author: GRAHAM BOWLEY and JANE PERLEZ

item.title: At Least 35 Dead in Iraq Violence
item.description: American troops killed at least five people in vehicles trying to drive through roadblocks in two separate episodes, military officials and witnesses said today.
item.author: DAMIEN CAVE

item.title: The Lede Blog: The Lede: F.B.I. Falafel Story Too Good to Be True
item.description: Did F.B.I. agents try to detect terrorists by tracking sales of Middle Eastern food?.
item.author: MIKE NIZZA

item.title: City Room: New Yorkers Welcome Papal Visit
item.description: Quinnipiac Poll: Most New Yorkers think Pope Benedict XVI's visit in April will be good for the city, but a quarter do not approve of how he is doing his job and hold unfavorable views of him.
item.author: SEWELL CHAN

item.title: DealBook Blog: Taking Stock of Citi’s Abu Dhabi Deal
item.description: The good news for Citigroup is that it just found $7.5 billion to freshen up its wilting balance sheet. The bad news is that it sacrificed a lot to get it — and it may still need more. The government of Abu Dhabi is not handing over bags of money to Citi for free. It will [...].
item.author: DEALBOOK

item.title: Dot Earth Blog: Google’s Search — for Clean Electricity
item.description: Google announced an initiative to invest in projects that aim to make nonpolluting technologies for generating electricity competitive with coal.
item.author: ANDREW C. REVKIN

item.title: Well Blog: Oversized Portions? Blame the Chef
item.description: The influence of restaurant chefs on how much you eat.
item.author: TARA PARKER-POPE
